findings.reason: Force push can destroy remote history. Use --force-with-lease if necessary.
findings.suggestion: Use `git push --force-with-lease` to prevent overwriting others' work

findings.reason: rm -rf is destructive and requires human approval. Explain what you want to delete and why, then ask the user to run the command manually.
findings.suggestion: Use `rm -ri` for interactive confirmation of each file

findings.reason: git reset --hard destroys uncommitted changes. Use 'git stash' first.
findings.suggestion: Use `git reset --soft` or `--mixed` to preserve changes

findings.reason: git clean -f/--force removes untracked files permanently. Review with 'git clean -n' first.
findings.suggestion: Use `git clean -i` for interactive mode to select files

findings.reason: rm -rf on root or home paths is EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. This command will NOT be executed. Ask the user to run it manually if truly needed.
findings.suggestion: Use `rm -ri` for interactive confirmation of each file
